text: Too bad that Pat's no longer allows simple substitutions on their menu. I always liked the fettuccini alfredo and an extra piece of their good bread instead of the side salad. Apparently can't do that anymore.
This pizza place provides horrible customer service. I will never order from here again. Hope this shitty ass place goes bankrupt. Yeet!
1hour and 10 minutes into delivery called pats. oh the driver had an accident . talked to manager, oh hes stuck in traffic. be there in 20. ill pass

Best and most affordable pizza delivery in the Printers Row/South Loop neighborhood. Ticks all the boxes on the heralded and much revered "Four F's" of the pizza delivery game- Fast, Friendly, and aFFordable.

BAIT AND SWITCH BE WARNED- their actual prices are NOT EVEN CLOSE to what shows on the Yelp menu. Very deceiving. Called to ask why the receipt was so expensive on delivery (medium pizza no toppings, soft drink, and mozzarella sticks $37 before tip?!) and got a lot of BS from the owner about "competitors" putting false prices on Yelp and how they can't get Yelp to change it.  Do you really think we're that stupid? Suggest corrections is right there on the Yelp menu with a link to log in for priority corrections as a business owner. "Mozzarella sticks, fried zucchini" $5 on the Yelp menu is actually $6.50 + $6.50 (two separate items) so it rings up as $13 instead of the $5 you thought you ordered. Pizza is $17.50 instead of $14. "i'm very sorry, I'm deeply sorry" if you're so sorry than comp the bill so we pay for what we thought we ordered, not waffle your way through excuses and BS and nonsense about how you're going to get your "attorney" to call Yelp in the morning. I have half a mind to go dump your greasy pizza back on your front door and start a chargeback. Thought it was strange that they didn't confirm the price on the order, and now that looks even more suspicions. I mean, I don't think I've ever ordered food without a price confirmation before they hang up. I know Yelp is pretty awful but this place comes across as a borderline scam themselves.

This was our first and last time ordering here.  Let's start with the good. We ordered a thin pizza for delivery. Delivery was good, just under an hour, and the delivery person was very nice.  The bad - the pizza was very greasy and we used 2 or 3 paper towels to soak up the grease. The pizza was tipped at some point so it was bare towards the center with the ingredients sliding towards the outside edge - this happened for about 1/4 of the pizza.

Always fresh ingredients. Thin crust is on point, and the staff is very nice to us. One time someone stole our pizza and they just made us a new one no problem. Honemade ranch dressing is like crack and they always remibd you to use coupons to get free stuff with tour order

Easily the best thin crust in Chicago. If you're lucky enough to be in their delivery zone (it's a pretty big delivery zone) I'd order them. For real, best thin crust in this city. When I tell people Pats there generally like "really?" I think the name throws people off but it really is the best.

I've lived down the street from this establishment for nearly 2 years. At one point I called the meatball sandwich, fries and soda "hands down the best deal in town."  Fast forward to about October or November, the great meatball sandwich I would sometimes get twice a week went from 3 meatballs down to 2. At first I thought this was strange but time after time, only 2 meatballs. Could I really complain, after all, it was still $7.25 with tax. Even though I felt I was being cheated, the sandwich was still a good one.  Tonight, after working a 12 hour day and not really having a chance to eat dinner, I let the time get past 11pm and I didn't have many choices. "I'll try the meatball sandwich again" I said to myself. What did I get? 2 meatballs, with a nice space in the middle of my sandwich, however, this time I was charged $8.34. Why in the last 4 or 5 months did I lose a meatball and pay $1 and some change more? I'm all about loyalty and I've been a loyal customer here as well as many of the neighborhood places that have good food, give you good service and treat you fairly. Pat's is friendly, has good food, however, I no longer feel treated fairly. I may get a thin crust pizza from here still from time to time, but to me, it's no longer good for anything else. To me anyway. It's no longer the "Best Deal in Town" and with the quality, won't ever be again.  Update 5/13/17 Went in there tonight at 11:35pm. Everyone was still working. Saw a half a dozen people in there. 3 of them looked at me. The guy that normally takes the orders was standing off to the side on his cell phone. I waited for a good minute or two and then bounced. I've been a pretty loyal patron for 2 years now but I'm done. I don't patronize places that don't appreciate your regular business so no more meatball sandwiches for me and no more pizzas for the family. Peace!
Pats has one of the best pepperoni pizzas! The crust is always perfectly crisp and the ingredients are very fresh. My favorite thin crust pizza!

$25 for a 14' thin crust pizza with three toppings (I think they raised the price in the past year)? I mean, it was enough to feed the BF and I but it was just all right for me, even as thin crusts go. For those of you who like tons of cheese on your pizza, you'll probably like the Pat's special, otherwise if you don't get the pats special you can create your own (at more than $2 per topping on top of a pretty hefty base price).  For a pick up and delivery place (there's nowhere to really sit in the "restaurant"), its really super pricy for what it delivers. and i think they raised the Pat's special personal pizza to $8+ now. Now i miss Enzo's :/

I got the fried chicken. It had absolutely no taste in the batter. Not even salt. For a side I got mashed potatoes and gravy. The mashed potatoes had more flavor than the fried chicken. The gravy was a salty broth. The garlic bread was okay. I will not be ordering this again.

Ordered delivery. Just a simple pepperoni pizza. It was fantastic! It arrived on time and hot and fresh. Our pizza was the thin crust. It is crispy and has a great taste. We will order again on our next visit.
Pat's is a great place to pick up a hot, fresh pizza. Thin crust is my personal favorite. Owner is great! Go to place when you have a pizza crave.

Horrible service!! Ordered delivery, the manager took my order incorrectly, when I called back to let them know she said,"I don't care, I'm not changing it. You can pay for another pizza." First and LAST time ordering here. Go to Lou Malnati's instead, better pizza, better service.

Their pizza is pretty good. Nothing to really rave about... but I'm also not really a thin crust gal. Breadsticks were okay too.  Now on the other hand, their desserts are amazing!! I have a sweet tooth 24/7 so I'm a little hard to impress but their tiramisu was perfection, and the portion was extremely generous. I hear the cheesecake is pretty good but I haven't tried myself.  Bottom line: it's cool but this place wouldn't be my first choice for pizza. ‍

Good pizza but they screw you.  Price online for a 12 inch one topping pizza is around $11.50 plus a can of soda should be about $13.50 for a pick up order.  Nope I ordered that and they charged me $18.33 and claimed the prices on THEIR WEBSITE are subject to change...yet they do not disclose that anywhere.  Will be filing a complaint with the BBB and unfortunately, my company of about 25 people who order from here at least once a month wont be coming back here.  Imagine if you went to the store to buy a $5 item, got to check out and they charged you $9 and said their prices can change.  HAHA what a joke. SHOCKING...as of about 3 mins ago they updated the prices to $12.25 for a small plus $2 for each topping.  Scam....artists

Great food experience! Ordered a new York steak sandwich on garlic bread w/cheese w/ grilled onions (med/well). The steak was a thick cut and tasted amazing. Also ordered the spicy wings which were a generous size and not overly spicy nor saucy(2oz blue cheese and side of celery). The four stars is solely based on food, the girl who took my order was rude and seemed aggravated for no apparent reason.  I ordered my steak sandwich(she breathes heavily and said "is that all"), this was my first item out of 3, she continued to breathe heavily and seem aggravated throughout the whole process. Although i do not expect 5star customer service at an establishment like this I do not want to feel like I am bothering a business for "their service".  Either way I will order again!

This is an awesome pizza joint if you love thin crust and a sweeter sauce. The crust is perfection-- right balance between crispy with a little bend to it. Good cheese to sauce ratio-- sausage is delish. Everybody's a different kind of pizza person. If you're a sauce person, definitely try out Pat's. Number one family run pizza delivery in or near the loop!

Thin crust personal pizza for about $6 and some change is the way to go! Call it in or just go over and order. I came home hungry one night and my doorman told me this place was open. It was about 10:45 on a Friday night and I needed to soak up some liquor before bed. Went over and ordered a sausage and cheese and they had it ready within 10 mins. I have repeated this operation on a couple of occasions so I obviously think its awesome...LOL! The guys behind the counter are pretty cool!

Oh ma lawd, I wuz mad hungry. I shoveled dis shizz down ma throat wid sum beer n den I ptfo. It looked rul gud doe. It wuz pricey but imma say it wuz gud. I ain't throw up or nuthin n da nap wuz baptized in A1 sauz. Frfr i neva slept so gud. In ma sleep, I met Jesus n his mom n stuf, it wuz immaculate dopenezz. I remember it bein rul thin n crispz. Uhhhhhh I shud prolly order frum dis hur pizza joint agen. I don't even remember chewing nothin. It was der, I took sum pix n then it wuz gone like sum dudes who ain't use protection wid dey sideho n find out wen da gurl sey she like "d" she talkin bout chyu daddy but da "d" stand for disappear cuz dayum dat boy iz goooone. Meyb dey put sumn in da sauz. Holla atchyo gurl.

After waiting over an hour for a 45 minute delivery, we were told our pizza was en route. After the following hour, we called and they said it will be another 20 minutes. Oh wait, the they had the wrong address. No, they couldn't find it. Ended up just canceling the order.  First and last time we'll order from here.
Terrible food. Terrible pizza. Not much else to say. So gross. The service here is a atrocious, they thought they knew customer service...did they just get hired out of high school? Losers...

Fast delivery and large portions. My kids loved the thin crust, and we all liked how the pizza wasn't too salty but still flavorful. Their ranch dressing was really good, and my daughter was also a fan of the garlic bread that came as a side with the spaghetti. Would definitely order from here again if in the area!

Boyfriend lives walking distance from here, which is why we order from here pretty frequently. We love getting the pastas, he got the meat tortellini with meat sauce and I usually get the angel hair pasta with pesto but decided to switch it up a bit and get fettuccini Alfredo. Everything was delicious.  We also got the soup this time with our pastas when we usually get salads, their soups are good minestrone and some chicken one I forgot the name.  Since we still wanted salads, we got our usual side salads with Italian dressing. Whenever we get our orders, they are always complete and the staff are pretty cool. Prices aren't bad and their portion sizes are more than enough. So if you're ever looking for something quick and craving Italian in the south loop- then check out pats :)

The local pizza place, I honestly just feel it could be a lot better especially with all the competition close by. I really want to give it 5 stars but the pizza I ordered had wayyy to much garlic. And the quality for the price you pay isn't there.

Have been meaning to write this review since Monday (Halloween).  Usually, I LOVE Pat's, but this experience was not good.  Placed an order at 4pm and was told it would arrive in an hour.  5:15 called to check on status and lady I spoke with said it was en route...5:30 and no pizza.  Called again at 5:30 and was told that my order had just left.  Finally arrive at 5:50...almost 2 hours after I had placed my order.  All 3 pizzas were cold and the one with vegetables was inedible because it was soggy.  Customer care was not consistent, and I didn't feel like they even cared that they had said the order would arrive within the hour, but it took almost 2 hours.

Hands down the best thin crust in Chicago. We've been picking up take-out from here for years now, since college days! It was then, and it still is the yummiest pizza in the south loop!  Also, say it with me..."homemade ranch!" Yes, that's right. Some people may not have known this, but their homemade ranch is seriously off the charts. Order it with your pizza, thank me later.
Great pizza with crispy crust and beef sandwiches. always taste fresh. Staff is usually friendly and very helpful.

The pizza at this place is absolutely delicious! My husband and I were first timers and the lady gave us the coupon from the menu for a free 6 pack. The pizza taste very fresh and the cheese is amazing! Highly recommended!

This is the BEST PIZZA EVER !!!!! The lady at the counter was really nice with us. When m we got home the pizza was looking so delicious. I tried and it was so fresh and delicious. I loved it. I recommend you always go to this place because the price is excellent and the quality is amazing.

When I moved to the south loop 7 years ago, I was on the hunt for a good thin crust. After trying a number of joints, I discovered Pat's. In my opinion, it is the best thin crust around. Consistently good. Out of all the many times I've ordered it, I have only had one mediocre pizza. I wholeheartedly recommend Pat's!

Not a bad pizza place or order out Italian restaurant. The minestrone soup is not bad. The Linguine with white clam sauce (oil based sauce) is also pretty good. Should try some of the other items next time around.

Our company moved into this neighborhood in June and this was our first experience at ordering Pizza for pickup. What a great experience!! From the very phone call we placed to order the pizza, to the warm, friendly and courteous staff that greeted us for our pickup, everything was tremendous! They even welcomed us to the neighborhood, and let us use a $2.00 off coupon from their menu!! We had the 16" Pat's Special and it was piping hot, and DEE-LI-CIOUS!!!!! We will definitely be back!!!
Yummy thin crust pizza with personable counter service. One of my local carryout go to's.
best pizza everrrrrr!!!!! We order it every week :) always on point. Beats any other pizza joint in chi!
Holy crap I can't give this place more than five stars but if I could I would. Delish, quick, delish, crusty, cheesy, and the best thin crust of life. Go here!!  Now!!  Go now!!

My husband and I are food snobs...we openly admit it. We're the type who sous vide at least once a week and literally spend hours pouring over recipes deciding our 'menu' every week. We take pizza pretty seriously. And seriously, this is one of the best thin crust pizzas we have ever encountered. Perfect ratio of sauce to cheese, and toppings all the way out to the edge. Perfect thin crust, crispy on the edges, but not cracker-dry. Thank you, Pat's...for being our new go-to.

Great thin pizza!  I recommend extra sauce and well done with pepperoni and mushrooms.  I ordered delivery through the Door Dash app and received my order within 40 minutes on a Saturday evening in Chicago!  I ordered an Italian Beef on the side which was ok.  I'll stick to the pizza next time.  Give Pats a try, one of the better thin crust pizza places out there!

I hated the pizza. The flavor did NOT blend with the pizza. It was like eating a Salad with too much going on. I order Quartrro cheese with BBQ chicken mushroom, spinach and jalapeños. The chicken BBQ did not taste ANYTHING like a chicken BBQ ... I tasted an overload of bbq sauce more than the chicken. The spicy chicken wings were not worth eating (not because the wings weren't spicy) it lacked FLAVOR... Price? TOO EXPENSIVE. My order came to 42 dollars. just one large pizza and wings ... that's it ... I actually tossed the pizza in the garbage along with the wings. I am not speaking out of spite. It just isn't worth it
Great flavor. A high quality restaurant with ample portions and great prices. Had the Italian Beef and my radio co-host saw mine and immediately order herself one. We loved them.

Been ordering from this place for awhile and remember it being much better in the past. I distinctly remember gushing over it while eating with my girlfriend one time. That said, I believe the quality is erratic and sometimes terrible. More recently, it's a matter of having later hours and being better than Papa John's, which isn't exactly inspiring. Bottom line, if you want pizza in south loop after 10, this should be your spot. Otherwise, skip it or drive to Pizano's on Madison and Wabash.

I've ordered from Pats for years of living in the south loop and have not had any issues. Last night I ordered a Pats Special and the crust was stuck to the cardboard.  I thought because it was hot and fresh after cooling down it would come apart but it didn't.  I contacted Pats and explained the situation and they said while veggies get soft and make the dough wet it was the very first ever time they've had a complaint.  I asked for a future credit and the manager Danny refused so I will frequent the other pizza places in the area.  So long from a long term pats pizza fan. FYI I told him I'd post something and he had no problem with it.
If you want thin crust, this is the place to go! Great, fast service, and the pizzas are always consistently good.
Great pizza and fast service. I love how thin and crispy the pizza is. This is my go to pizza place in the south loop.

This is the quintessential Chicago tavern pizza! Exactly what we wanted! The crust is thin and cracker crispy with a good proportion of fresh and tasty toppings to cover the pie. We ordered for delivery on a Saturday night and the pizza arrived still hot and crispy - it was perfect. Great pizza and will definitely order again!

Quick and friendly delivery, very good thin crust pizza, particularly extra crispy and extra sauce (I took this advice from another reviewer); however, when I ask for bread and butter I don't expect to get something resembling a hot dog bun. It's OK, Pat's, off night. I will still likely order this pizza once a week, if you pay for my gym membership!
I have only ordered delivery, but the delivery pizza is delicious! I recommend the pesto pizza or pepperoni. Both are delicious.

Speedy order & delivery, fresh food, but extremely bland! I ordered Pat's special, I felt like adding salt to a pizza! Literally never have a considered doing that. And the mozzarella sticks had zero flavor, sauce was not great. I've had better frozen mozzarella sticks and pizza. Would not order again.

The prices online are not up to date and when the delivery arrived the bill was 62% higher. The store manager would not offer to match the online menu price then proceeded to lie and say "prices are subject to change" is a disclaimer. It is not written anywhere on the site. I sent the pizza back. I'm sure the food is fine but when you have that level of incompetence managing the store, it doesn't matter how good the food is.

So happy to find a great neighborhood pizza delivery spot!! We ordered 4 thin crust (well done and easy cheese) pizzas on valentines day and they delivered our pizzas exactly at the time we asked! The pizzas were still hot and crispy. Pizzas we had: Giardinera Jalapeno, Garlic, Green pepper onion Spinach, Onion, Garlic (THIS WAS THE GROUP FAVORITE) Super fresh and great service. Highly recommend it!

We were happily surprised that this is our favorite pizza place here in Chicago! It's just good and has been consistently delicious every time we order.   I'd order this before Malnatis(also good...), Gino's(yuck), pequods (yuck)... And all of the others around downtown.  They also have fresh salads, yummy pasta, and have been friendly when we order and pick up. Thanks Pats!

I have been looking for a good thin crust pizza place since I moved into printers row and I found it.  It is better than the place my family always eat at in the burbs and any other thin crust i have tried in the city.  It is nice, crisp, the sauce is amazing, and PINEAPPLE is a topping! Staff is always very friendly and I like that they have such a variety of soda to choose from.  I mean a ton of options.  For those who complained there is no where to sit and eat, its a pick up or delivery place what do you expect?  There is a counter with a few high level chairs however if you need a place to eat.  It is a little pricey but that is because it 100% worth it.  I found my new go to pizza place and could not recommend this place enough.

I love Pat's. Being in the neighborhood and walk past here every day after work, I have to fight myself from getting a pizza daily. This is the staple of a walk up counter pizza joint. They do not have slices, but no worries, they are usually quick. I typically don't even call ahead, but just stop in and order. 25 mins later, my large pizza is ready to take home (have been in here during lunch and it's even quicker with their individual pies). There is very minimal seating; more or less counter space to grab their special on your lunch break. The owner is extremely friendly and accommodating. I've only had their thin crust pepperoni and sausage, but I'm afraid to try anything else, because I enjoy it so much. The crush is thin and crispy with a great balance of savory sauce, toppings, and cheese. Most importantly, the flavors just work together. I have no complaints or critiques. Pat's is a no frills spot cranking out pizzas for all to enjoy.

Ordered a medium thin crust, as others have mentioned it's definitely not on the cheaper side of pizza (as compared to other chain stores). Sauce was good, on the sweeter side, and contrasted nicely against the saltiness of the pepperoni and mushroom we ordered. When craving some higher quality pie, would definitely order again.

Pizza is alright.   Thin crust is the go to here.   Toppings are not thick really.   Not exactly a cheap pie.   Deliveries will take over an hour easily.   I've never had mozzarella  sticks be delivered warm .  Honestly, go to your regular thin crust spot.   I wanna try to like the place because it's close, but it's just the worst service I've dealt with in terms of pizza.   Place needs to figure it out.
Solid pizza choice. Many think of the other chains but this place has been around forever: good pizza, reasonable prices and quick service - all good

Visiting Chicago for training... this is the best meal I've had yet! Delivered super fast, and so hot it burned my tongue, the way it should be. I would have given 5 stars but the kid who took my order wasn't exactly friendly, and there were no plates or napkins with the delivery even though I'm in a hotel. Might be my fault for not requesting them. Would order from here again in a heartbeat!

Best thin crust Pizza in Chicago.  No debate.  My boss ordered from here about 6 years ago, and I never looked back.  The Pat's (sausage, onion, green pepper) is my fave.  Not really a dine-in place, just some counter space.  Probably great for a quick lunch. I always order delivery, always tip big because I never want this place to go away.
I love the sandwich menu, great value for money, quality is there too.  Im also a fan of the pizza

Best thin crust pizza in Chicago hands down. Lasagna wasn't half bad either. We lived about a 2 minute walk away until we moved. I would still walk back over there for that pizza. Service was always great and friendly. And they do deliver to our new neighborhood!
Ordered from here while staying at the Hyatt mccormick. The pizza wasn't bad, just your average thin crust pizza. It delivered in a fast amount of time. Took only about 35-45 minutes.

Beware that this is not the same Pat's Pizza as up North. I looked at the online Menu that redirected to the northside location assuming they were owned by the same people. Ended up ordering a meat lover's pizza, which they knew how to make, but cost me like $35, for a medium. The sausage was so greasy that the pizza fell apart and it just tasted awful. This was a regular crust pizza. It kinda sickens me to live in Chicago and have knock off pizza places like this.  Maybe I just ordered the worst thing on the menu, but never returning here again.

I came here for dinner one night and ordered the Pat's special with cheese fries.  Preparation took a while (25-30 mins) but the owner was very friendly and chatted with me during the wait.  When I received the food, I was very impressed with the quantity.  The pie had pretty good size for the price and came with a free soda, assorted crackers, and probably half a dozen packs of grated cheeses and other seasonings.  The order of cheese fries was also huge and filled an entire takeout box.  Both tasted pretty good and I'd recommend a visit if you're hungry and craving pizza and/or fries.
We order pizza pan with pineapple , ham and cheese ,we just love it . The pizza was delicious
Best thin crust pizza in the south loop area. My favorite is pepperoni with extra cheese well baked.

I live in the south loop and can't stand this place. Workers are rude as sh*t! I always get attitude from the people that answer the phone, especially the girl that always answers. She is so rude!! It's as if taking my order is bothering her.  Then some of the delivery guys rarely say thank you when being tipped extra ($3-5 extra). Apparently the workers here don't understand common courtesy.  You'd think for what they charge for pizza, the service would be better.  Looking forward when another pizza establishment in the south loop starts their delivery(Aurelio's Pizza). Pats pizza will definitely lose tons of business! I won't be calling back after today. Too many other places with better food/pizza and better customer service!!!
I love this place. Best pizza in the city. But when they charge me $26 for a medium pizza and take close to two hours to deliver, I may have to reconsider my options.

One of the best thin crust pizza places in Chicago. I go with the Pepperoni and Sausage but the Spinach is also good. Try the jalapeno poppers for an appetizer. Been ordering from this spot for years....

This is my go-to place to order pizza from. I've ordered from here countless times, and it's consistently great! The thin crust pizza with pepperoni or sausage (and jalapeño if you like it spicy) is my typical order. The fried zucchini are also excellent. I did order the meat lasagna one time, which was just ok, but this is a pizza place, so I learned my lesson and will stick with ordering pizza.

Ordered food for the office, gave us the wrong pizza and we didn't realize until two slices had been grabbed. Called Pats and although they delivered the correct one- asked us if we really did only take two slices and then took the pizza back!!! My office was shocked: were they planning on still selling that pizza??!? How can they trust that our office didn't touch the whole thing? :-( They also didn't tell me that sandwiches don't come with fries if it's delivery. WHAT. I don't see why that should be a thing, if we're paying the same price and paying delivery AND tip, I should still get fries. I don't know if that's a quality/freshness issue associated with delivery time, but either way- very disappointed. My coworkers and I won't be going back. Shame, the chx parm sandwich was really good.
My go to pizza spot in printers row. Comfort food without the grease. My favs include personal 8" pizza(mmmmmm...Thin&crunchy!!), house salad, fried mushrooms & zucchini, eggplant parmesan.
Solid quality pizza. Perfect blend of saucy and cheesy!  We came here on a rainy night and did not leave disappointed!

I'm a Pat's fan!  In my opinion, it's the best thin-crust pizza in Chicago.  The crust is nice and crispy and the sauce is perfectly tomatoey and a little sweet.  They deliver to our house in River West.  Our usual order is a large pizza with sausage and pepperoni.  Soooo good!

Falling out of love....Used to think the pat's pizza was the best after my office ordered it for lunch and have been getting for years.  But tonight their thin crust was a little too thin, it was kind of soggy.  Wonder if they changed their recipe?  Also, kind of expensive.  Almost $23+ tip/deliver for a medium pats (sausage, pepper, mushroom, onion).   I think they are using frozen crust now....wonder what is going on?

Best thin crust pizza in Chicago - no frills just good food. We ordered pizzas for a party and were able to taste a variety of toppings which were all fresh. We liked it so much that it has become our new go to pizza delivery place.

I order pizza from Pat's often both pick up and delivery. The price of an individual pizza comes with a can of soda. I didn't realize I was missing soda until I received my order. Then I remembered that the woman that took my order didn't offer soda. When I called to see why I wasn't offered pizza the same young lady said soda comes with pick up orders only. Please note that there is a $2.50 delivery fee. So I said to the young lady...I paid a delivery fee for a delivery that was a 2 minute walk and I couldn't get a soda? She said I'm just telling you what the manager said. Rude! The manager then confirmed and also said they don't give fries for sandwich deliveries. When I said that's horrible customer service the manager said its up to the customer to ask for these items. Sooo...If you decide to order at Pat's be sure to ask for soda or fries...otherwise you'll feel cheated for OKAY food.

Good place to get some quick pizza near the South Loop. Was dinner time and heard they had great thin crust pizza so I called and spoke to a guy who was relatively patient with me despite all the questions I asked about costs. Went ahead and ordered a Large (16 inch) 2 topping thin crust pizza with pepperoni and sausage and paid about $23 to go pick it up. It was ready in 20 min. Pro: The pizza tasted great, the thin crust was the type that wasn't cracker thin but soft and thin. Great combo for me. Healthy amounts of toppings, no shortchanging there. Good stuff for a hungry dinner/late night situation Con: A little bit pricey though in my opinion, $23 for large 2 topping, and the 1 topping wasn't that much cheaper like $20-$21 if I remember correctly, and it doesnt stop there, the Medium or one size down at 14 was only a few dollars cheaper at like $19-$20.  Anyway, good tasting pizza if you are a high roller in the south loop willing to dish out some money for a good tasting pizza.

Horrible customer service. I placed an order for pick up and when I got there the woman who was behind the desk was so Unbelievably rude. She clearly couldn't handle answering the phone, helping customers who walk in and packing up to go orders.  She couldn't be bothered to take care of me when I first got there just brushed me to the side and said its not ready yet. I waited for 20 minutes for her to tell me they didn't put in my order and if I was sure I called the right pats pizza. I must look like an idiot to her. Then a cook put my pizza on the counter so I guess they "found it". She didn't apologize or acknowledge anything. The pizza was just ok. But thanks to that woman I'll never order there again. Why do people work In Customer service if they are miserable and mean? I don't understand.

I have ordered the thin crust from here a couple of weeks ago, I fell in love with it but today I ordered the same pizza and it was like having an eraser! Dry, cold and tasteless. Don't know if I will order again.
By far the best thin crust in the city of Chicago. Their pizza is so thin, greasy, and cheesy. It is heaven. I only wish I lived within their delivery area.

I don't give 1 star reviews often. I wanted to ordered pizza delivery last night which is a rare occurrence for me. I didn't realize finding a "regular" pizza that wasn't deep dish or thin crust would have been so difficult, so I searched Yelp for places in the South Loop and just called around asking who had what I wanted until Pat's said yes. I knew I wanted a regular Papa John's-type pizza that wasn't Papa John's, but in hindsight this was my mistake and I should have just ordered from there and been totally satisfied. Instead I got a super thick pizza from Pat's... the sauce was about 3 times the necessary amount and there were gobs of cheese everywhere. It looked like a heart attack waiting to happen. The pepperoni was visibly on top of the pie, but the sausage was imbedded somewhere within, among the sauce and cheese ridiculousness. If that's your thing, great, but it's not mine and I was highly disappointed... especially for $28! Seriously, I almost choked when the lady over the phone gave me the cost for ONE pizza delivery which should have been my sign to hang up (again my fault) but I figured it must be good given the solid star ratings... Nope, not worth it a dollar in my mind. But hey, this is my review and my opinion. Take it with a grain of salt.

Tried it for the first time today. This is how thin crust should be done. Paper thin crust. Good flavor all around. Ordered a medium sausage and jalapeño, extra sauce well done. It was perfect and ready for pickup in 20 min.
The staff is absolutely wonderful! I stopped in on the way home from work one night and was not disappointed. I highly recommend this place!

What a great surprise! This Pat's is not related to the one I used to know on the North Side so I wasn't sure what to expect. Our options for delivery in the South Loop are pretty limited so we were excited to find a place that would come to us on a cold, snowy winter's night. They told us 45 minutes and it was 45 minutes. They have coupons online, and there was no problem redeeming it. The delivery fee must be baked into the price, which was also nice. But the main thing, of course, was the pizza itself, which was excellent- super thin crust, crisp and a great taste. Definitely not greasy. We had to warm it up a bit and I could have used more mushrooms, but overall, this was a very favorable experience. We will definitely be ordering from Pat's again. I noticed that they also have sandwiches and pasta, too!

We were getting tired of the deep dish pizza and longed for something different. The reviews here looked pretty good so we gave it a shot. We ordered a large cheese thin crust pizza and asked the gentleman at the counter what else he recommends. He suggested the rib tips and the garlic bread with cheese, so we ordered both. The rib tips were delicious and covered in the best bbq sauce I've had. The garlic bread was great as well. The pizza was some of the best I've had. The sauce was slightly sweet just the way I like it. He also threw in a six pack of soda for free. This was the best value I had in the week I stayed here. All that food and drink was just slightly less than $30 and the staff couldn't have been friendlier.  In fact, we're going back for dinner. Also, this is a very small place with counter seating for about 8 people. I assume they do mostly take out and delivery.

Went to the Bears game for Monday Night Football and stayed at the Hilton on Michigan Ave. Thank god for this place because it made me forget about the disaster that happened at Solider Field! Awesome thin crust pizza! Order it "well done" and it'll come crispy but not dry or burnt! Well done Pat's!

Whoever the woman is answering their phone over there is very rude and disrespectful. It was if taking my order and answering a question was a huge problem for her. I have been ordering from Pats for 3+ years, the pizza is very good, but based on how I was treated on the phone I probably won't be going back.   Horrible.

I got a coupon mailer in the mail (If you are advertising a restaurant, the mailers apparently work. I never thought much about this until I used this coupon - but - print advertising worked for my uncle's dentistry in the 90s so I guess my 'revelation' is moot - I am not sure where I am going here). All of the coupons came out to saving three dollars. Except the one weird one where if you buy 15 large pizzas, you get a case of soda. I wonder if they meant a 12-pack of cans - I'll never know - I don't plan on buying fifteen large pizzas.  I get the feeling they are nice enough that they might give you that free pack if you buy only fourteen or thirteen large pizzas. Well, I ordered over the phone. It came in about 20 minutes or so. I forget. it was very hot when it got here. The delivery person was nice.  After tax and delivery fee and tip it was kind of expensive, part of that was getting three toppings. I don't get toppings pricings. Okay, my review: The pizza was as good as this picture looks to you: yelp.com/biz_photos/pats…

I have yet to find another non-chain pizza place in the loop for lunch.  Small 8" thin crust pepperoni pizza is good!  The only problem is the 8" isn't on the menu.  There's nothing special about the pizza but it is good.

Pat's was alright, I don't have too much to say.  The giardinera and sausage combination was good don't get me wrong but man it was expensive for thin crust.  If i'm paying that much for pizza, it better be chicago style deep dish!!!  The quality and quantity did not justify the pricing but if you're not worried about the budget, it's a decent place to get some thin crust pizza. It's the kind of place i'd go back for with a coupon.  Service was nice and fast! : )

IMO, this is the best thin crust cheese pizza in the city.   Their sauce is on the sweet side, but that's probably what makes it so delicious.   For whatever reason, their + toppings pizzas are just OK (still better than average); but, if you're in a purist's mood for cheese only?  Pat's every time.

Fantastic pizza place, the best in the South Loop.  I get delivery only (always fast) and always order thin-crust.  Pepperoni & Mushroom, and Sausage & Spinach are both fantastic combinations.  The sauce is what makes the pizza.
Best customer service I've seen for a small pizza shop. Their wings are some of the best I've had in the city and their pizza is top notch. Highly recommended!!!!

Part of a taste test when my family came into town, we put Pat's up against County Inn from Elmhurst (others were Due's and Pequod's for deep dish). To make it a true taste test, we just got pepperoni and onion to match the County Inn pizza. The crust on this one was incredible, cracker thin, crispy and delicious. Hands down a favorite among our group of 7, including one who has been biased towards County Inn his whole life. The toppings were good but may be able to be spiced up a bit. Always a great option if you're looking for something quick, or for some great thin crust pizza.

Ace has a coupon for Tuesday special that has no date on it for expectation.  Called to place order and would not accept.  Maryann needs to take some management/customer service classes and print date on them if they are going to tell you no.   One star but you can take that away too
Probably one of the best thin crust pizzas ever. A small hole in the wall place but well worth it.

During our little outing in downtown chicago, we were still on a pizza craving even though we had pizza the day before.  Wherever we were, there was a pizza place in walking distance so we just wanted to grab a small bite to eat.  We found this place that made pizzas but it wasn't too big.  We ordered the Pat's special, which came with sausage, mushrooms, green peppers, and onions for $7.50.  It took about 15 minutes to cook which I thought was pretty long considering how small the pizza was.  The pizza was decent but it wasn't anything to spectacular.  Good find to eat if you want to hold your stomach for a delicious meal forthcoming. NOTE: -Free drink included -no bathrooms -small place (walk up to counter and order)

This is a small place you'd probably just walk past without giving it a second look, but let me tell you, have the pizza here and you won't miss this place again. I'm from out of town so I'm not sure how popular this place is among the locals but you've got a fan in Minnesota that will be back. Not only for the pizza but for the customer service the owner is such a nice guy and makes every customer feel welcomed.
Great thin crust pizza. Everything looks very clean. It is a take out place but quality is good
Worst pizza I've ever had in Chicago! 50 bucks for two large pizzas and the box probably had more flavor than the pizza did. Never again!

My boss ordered delivery from here for lunch today, and here are my thoughts. - thin crust: crispy - sauce: I think there was sauce - cheese: there was definitely cheese - sausage: there was sausage on the pizza All the elements of pizza were there, but it just wasn't very flavorful. Overall, very "meh." Unfortunately, the boss said it was significantly cheaper than Giordano's so I think we will be ordering from here from now on. I'll have to request the stuffed or think crust next time and see if that's any better.

I've been going to Pat's for 4 years. The pizza is satisfying for the area, unless you want deep dish or some kind of speciality. What I really love there is their Meatball sandwich - for $5.50 with a generous amount of steak fries AND they always give you a free pop, it is hands down the best meatball sub you'll get around here. Highly recommended.

This is our Sunday night staple.  By far the best thin crust pizza in the city.  Jalapeño and bacon is our favorite. Just ask for well done if you like the cheese brown and the crust crunchy. We get it delivered and it always arrives hot and in a timely manner.
Best thin crust pizza in the city, hands down.  Delivery is fast, ingredients are fresh and the pizza is delicious.  My only complaint is that I'm not within their delivery zone now that I moved!

I've been ordering from Pat's for 18 years and today I'm sad to say, I'm done with Pat's.  I've had so many bad experiences with orders being correct, wrong credit card #'s etc. and today the pizza was awful.  The usual crisp thin crust was almost deep dish style.  it was terrible.  I called Pat's and the manager Danny blew me off and said sorry.  Well, here's sorry.  I'm done.  I wash't looking for anything other than how can I help you, but that won't in the cards. So long Pat's, I can no longer recommend you with such passé attitudes and bad service.

Husband and I are new to area, walked in here to find out what the hype was about. Definitely worth the 20 minute wait!  Nice staff. We got a thin crust and it had delicious buttery crust! Also got the loaded salad which I wasn't a huge fan of but the pizza would of off set anything it was that good. This will be our new Friday night pizza

I've been eating pats for a number of years as I work about a mile away and have never been disappointed. Several of my coworkers regularly order from here as well. With all the excellent choices for the best food around Chicago in the area my staff and I always find ourselves going back to Pats. From pizza,  to pasta, burgers, chicken strips, mozz sticks, and an amazing grilled chicken sandwich it's hard to go wrong with Pats.  The staff has gotten to know me over the years and is always very helpful and friendly. I couldn't think of a bad thing to say about this place and I've ordered from here at least twice a week for the last several years. Give them a shot, you will not be disappointed!

I've lived in Printer's Row for about a year now and finally decided to give Pat's a try, after reading all of the great reviews in here.  What can I say, I was not all that impressed.  I got the Pat's Special and the pizza was nothing out of the ordinary.  The crust in the middle was not crispy, the flavor was just average.   Honestly to me it was pretty darn close to stuff you can get at Papa John's or Dominoes.  I'm a little upset that I spent $22 on a pizza at Pat's when I could've gone to Lou Malnati's on State and paid a little less for much better quality & flavor; Lou's thin crust sausage pizza is amazing!  Sorry Pat's, your prices are too high for the quality that I experienced.
The pizza at Pat's Pizzeria is pretty good. Many of the other things on their menu are worth trying as well, such as their pasta dishes and sandwiches.

Basically the best pizza in Chicago!!!! Pat's pizza has a special recipe that no one knows because their pizza is sooo good!  No idea what they do differently than other places, but whatever they are doing it's amazing! I always ask for my pizza to be extra sauce and extra crispy! The sauce is delicious!!!! If your in the south loop area looking for a pizza place ... Please try it out!!! They r good for thin crust! If your looking for a deep dish just head over to Lou's on State.

I work in the loop and when craving a Chicago style pizza, I won't hesitate to rally up my co-workers to pitch in the pot for a thin crust pizza with sausage, onions, light bell pepper, extra sauce and cooked well done!  This has become a monthly craving around the office and when we get a hankering for good pizza, Pat's is definitely on the top of our pick list.
Very good, fast delivery, pizza was really hot. I'll be calling again.

BEST thin crust Pizza I've had...I've lived in Chicago my whole life and this, hands down is my favorite. It was so good, I actually ordered another pizza while I was eating the first order. The woman who delivered, looked confused coming back to the same house. It's OK, I have no shame. I would highly recommend this to anyone who loves thin crust, it's crispy, flavorful and something I'd like to eat, all the time. Enjoy!
Tiny pizza joint that is perfect for picking up a quick pie to go.  The thin crust was very good, but the wings were too sweet in my book.  My husband liked them, though.
Food = 4 stars Service/Delivery = 1 star we order from here once or twice a week.  the food is good, but they always forget something

I tried Pat's Pizza for the first time tonight. I've lived in Chicago for almost 17 years and had never found a go-to pizza place but Pat's may have finally changed that. I'm a thin crust lover (sorry Chicago deep dish... You're tasty for a treat when out-of-town guests visit but you are just too heavy to be my usual order) and Pat's has a pretty amazing one. They also have nice, courteous people working there: from the person answering the phone to the delivery guy. I'm sure the people making the pizzas are equally nice, I just didn't have the opportunity to meet them. If I did I'd thank them for a mighty fine pizza! This Yelp review will have to sufficie: thanks!

For those unaware, Chicago has two of its own styles of pizza: deep dish, and thin crust. (Thin crust is traditionally cut "party style" - in squares rather than wedges.)  As with deep dish, most people have a favorite supplier. Pat's is our favorite Chicago-style thin-crust pizza. The crust is wonderfully crispy, and holds up a surprising weight of cheese and toppings, while the sauce is well seasoned and strong, but not over-applied. If you're in the area, make sure to check this place out.

This is hands down the best pizza in the south loop. My husband and I have ordered from Pat's about 7 times now and have been really happy with our orders every time. Must get the gardinera. It is super fresh and must be homemade.

Not really a huge fan of thin crust. Didn't blow me away. It was just thin crust pizza. Delivery was fast though. Order was correct. Just not really impressed. I can't really say anything more. It wasn't greasy. There.
This place is top notch! I don't know what it is about their pizza that just taste really good.  They also sell salads, wings, and a variety of other side dishes.
This pizza is fantastic. Best thin crust I've tasted in a long time. No photo because it was gone in about 20 minutes.  Nom nom nom mmmmm

I had Pat's for the first time last night, which is crazy since I've lived in the South Loop for a year now. Anywho, Pat's has a really yummy thin crust at a reasonable price. I enjoy a little more sauce on my pizza, but overall it was tasty. Quick service, friendly guy behind the counter, can't ask for much more for a quick pizza stop.

Love the thin crust pizza here, it's thin and crunchy, you got to try it!  We usually order the Pat's Special 16" - and it is more than enough for 2 hungry people (sausage, mushrooms, green peppers and I order light onions).  Sometimes we even get the cheesy garlic bread, which is tasty in my book. It looks like they use a hoagie roll and layer it with fresh mozzarella and garlic and bake it until it's melty and perfect. Yummo.   Tonight I ordered at 7:30, they said it would be here in 45-60 minutes and then at 8pm sharp the delivery person was downstairs outside my apt.. :) ps- tiramisu is good too (lots of coffee flavor and not too sweet!)
Mmmmm...Pats, so good.  Love the crust, but don't get sausage or it will weigh it down.  Mushroom and pepperoni is a great choice!  I heart you, Pats!

Very good pizza - the crust is very thin and crispy, but still held all of our toppings!  We ordered a 16" for 5 people, which seemed small at first, but was enough.  We also ordered a salad and the ingredients were very fresh.  Solid value. 215/365
Best thin crust pizza in Chicago. Service is great also. Prices are reasonable and solid coupon offers.

I concur with Christine V. and Anuj S. Pat's thin crust pizza is surprisingly thin (thinner than a cracker), yet remarkably holds all the toppings! Tonight we ordered a 12" to our office and on my half, I ordered pepperoni, black olives & green peppers, and it was loaded with the toppings! Yet, while the crust was thin and crispy, it was also solid and supportive, and didn't fall apart in my hands as I was eating it. We also ordered side salads, but mine is in the fridge for lunch tomorrow, as I was full quickly! (My colleague ordered fries, so there was that... they were yummy, but now I just openly admitted - on the Internet - that I ate pizza and fries for dinner... d'oh!) The delivery man was super friendly, and knew my colleague from way back. That's what I love about Chicago. It's a big city, yet a small town. :)

Pat's is my go-to pizza delivery place in downtown Chicago for thin crust pizza.  The pizza is perfectly crispy.  The toppings are fresh and flavorful.  It's delivered quickly and the people on the phone are nice. I wish there were some better coupons or deals at this place.  If that had been the case, I might even order Pat's more often. I've never been there in person, but I look forward to visiting in person as well. I'm a big fan and I highly recommend Pat's.
Very good thin crust option in the city. Their sauce was terrific...try it, there are other good pizza places but not many who serve great thin crust!

I go here at least once a week, and it is always superb.  I've been going here for 2 years consistently, and have yet to have a sub-par experience.  You can't go wrong with traditional thin crust pepperoni or sausage pizza.  Their burgers are also quite delicious.  Best pizza in the South Loop hands down.

Don't pay attention to the bad reviews; those are small exceptions.  I have NEVER had a bad experience from Pat's.  Everything I have had here has been exceptional, and I go there at least once a week. The pizza is delicious; all of these pizza snobs don't know what they are talking about.
So delicious I think I burned my mouth in four different places

So this is cheap "Italian food" at a price way too high. I put Italian in quotes because the menu is so extensive, everything from thin crust pizza to BBQ and steak. Any time you see a menu with this much stuff and this much range, you know you are in for some trouble. One wonders just how often they sell the 19 dollar Shrimp Dinner. Yes, the prices are way too high for a place like this. They sell a side of toasted bread and butter for $2.75, basic tortellini is 13 dollars! You could easily buy 3 or 4 bags of better quality tortellini from Trader Joes for that price. The pizza is spendy as well, unless you get a plain cheese. I had sworn this place off after going twice last summer, its only a 2 minute walk from where I live. But being in Chicago(downtown no less) there is plenty of great, more authentic, Italian food nearby, that actually is less expensive. Panozzo's Italian Market has real Italian food(no pizza, but hey who needs pizza), its actually less expensive too. It's maybe 12 blocks away, but it's worth it. Anyway, for my most recent and hopefully final visit I was dragged here by some friends who wanted pizza for a friends' birthday. Not eager to spend double digits on an average pizza, I decided to go for an Italian eatery staple, an Eggplant Parmesan sandwich. At 7.25 it was NOT worth it, soggy, no flavorful sauce, very little cheese, soggy eggplant that wasn't really seasoned. I ordered a cannoli and got carrot cake instead, which wasn't too bad, but I ordered a cannoli and last time I checked, cannoli and carrot cake don't sound much alike. Bottom line: Not worth it, walk a little more and find Italian food that is better and lighter on the wallet.

I've had 2 pizzas from here. The 1st was a small cheese, sausage & Mushroom and I ate the whole thing on my car on the way home. The next time me and another person knocked off a medium cheese,sausage,pepper&onion.  The crust is a perfect thickness and the sauce and mozzeralla is very flavorful . An Excellent pie and great service too.

First time ordering delivery.  Arrived quickly.  Nice thin crust veggie.  But - price I found online was the old one.  $4 surprise at my door.  Would order again, just need to double check prices found online

Best thin crust in South Loop. Take out & Delivery only.  I ordered my sausage with extra sauce and cooked crispy (my usual) and then came through with flying colors! It was cooked perfectly to order. I just walked in on a Saturday night and placed my order at the counter and I was walking out with a gorgeous pie in only fifteen minutes. That is stellar service for some awesome pizza. Rock on Pat!

It is apparent Pats Pizza has never been busy before as they are unable to handle a simple order on Superbowl Sunday.  Also, if you like being placed on hold for at least 15 minutes, then this is the place for you.
A very good pie.  It's a dumpy little hole in wall joint but man they know how to makeadapizza.

horrible....ordered a 16' veggie thin and a meatball sandwich delivered.  it arrived within the time promised.  no meatball sandwich..... that came 30 minutes later after we called.  Pizza was way over cooked.  The cheese was black in spots and the entire top was dark brown.  Won't be going there again.too many other choices in Chicago.
Yum yum and double yum!  Always order the thin crust pizza and you will not be disappointed!

Product is hit or miss.  At times this is one of the best thin crust pizzas in the area and at times it is a bit disappointing for what you pay.  I like the paper thinness of the crust.  The people are usually nice there.  Good selection of toppings.  Worth a try.

Unfortunately, this place has not been very good lately.  The last 3 or 4 pizzas I've ordered have either been undercooked, missing ingredients, or so poorly prepared that I eat less than a quarter of it before giving up.  Totally inconsistent product now which is too bad because the owner is very nice.  Not sure what happened.
Great thin crust pizza, but overpriced. A 12" can cost almost $20 for just 4 additional ingredients? $2.75 surcharge for delivery? No thanks.
I think the price is worth it! The thin crust pizza was probably the best thin crust I have ever eaten (comparable to the pizza I ate in Milan, Italy). Pretty delicious.
Best thin crust around! BBQ wing are also good. If you get a large pizza mention a coupon and they'll throw in a six pack of pop! ;)

This place is the most inconsistent pizza joint in the city. One day you'll get a fantastic thin crust pizza, the next time, you'll get a sad excuse for a pie. They burn them often, skimp on ingredients, and are generally rude on the phone. The prices are INSANELY HIGH for what you get. I'll just leave it at that... 5 Stars, I think not - even on their best day which is few and far between.

Kind of went out of my way to try this pizza joint.  Had a layover at Union Station, waiting for a train to go out West, and decided to walk here on a hot day to try one of their pies.  I was only a party of one so I got a 12" sausage pizza hoping to make two good meals out of it. I paid over $15 bucks for a relatively small, very thin crust pizza and only one topping.  I could see padding the price if there was some serious overhead but this is a carry-out/delivery only storefront.  Since this is a cracker type dough, you obviously use significantly less of every ingredient you top it with from the sauce, the cheese and the extra goodies.  I just don't see the justification of this high price tag especially since upon opening the box I was so disappointed. Sausage was scarce and so was the sauce, which ended up creating a very dry product.  I get the need for restraint when dealing with a cracker crust but this was down right stingy.  I knew I was only going to eat a couple of the pieces so I stole chunks of meat from other squares to beef up my slice.  That's kind of pathetic.  Glad I wasn't sharin.

I didn't believe my family when they told me this pizza has a crust that is thinner than a cracker. I thought "how does it hold all the toppings"?? I figured that the tomatoes made the crust soggy and the pizza would flop around like a limp noodle.  However, I was wrong! This pizza has to be seen to be believed. It is almost a joke how thin this pizza is because it does not make sense. The crust alone is worth the drive to get this pizza. It is def one of my favorite pizza eating experiences in my lifetime.  They give you a little plate with olives and cheese to start along with crusty bread and marinara for dipping and you can draw on the parchment paper they lay out ontop of the red checkered tablecloth. You won't be bored waiting for your pie! The toppings are perfect as well, but the crust is the star!!

Best (so far) thin crust pizza I have ever had. I mean, seriously! I have ordered twice here within a month, and every time its excellent. Needless to say, between two of us, it's gone before morning. Pat's is my go to pizza place for sure!

Thought we would try it because of the Yelp reviews.  Must have been sent in by their relatives.  It's a small take out place which we should have asked before we went.  Salad was good, but pizza was below average.  Come on,  this is Chicago, home of amazing pizza!  Will be more careful with Yelp reviews in the future.

Meh at best. Probably not a smart move ordering the pasta, but I was craving some carbs and went ahead anyway. Ordered the shrimp & rigatoni. Only had 4 shrimp, half of which weren't even full. They were clearly frozen and tasted that way. The sauce was watery and flavorless. A can of crushed tomatoes and a few spices wouldve been better

The food averages from good to great.  The service is what really gets that extra star. Hot & spicy wings are plentiful for $7.  Not actually spicy but you probably won't turn them down.  Pizza with mushrooms and pepperoni has a nice thin crust and a very nice flavor.  Doesn't taste greasy.  If it's frozen, it doesn't seem obvious. The service was the best.  The gentleman behind the counter was very polite, courteous, informative and everything you'd expect out of a waiter who's definitely going to get that 20% tip. Interior seating is minimal as this is a mostly take-out place.  They work hard to keep it clean. Pepsi, no Coke.

In a town dominated by the deep stuff Pat's really sets themselves apart when it comes to a thin crust. I'd probably opt for two of their slices stacked on top of one another over almost anything thick in Chicago.  Why? Besides the fact that I'd shower in their delicious sauce, they have toppings galore. Almost anything you could imagine ever going on a pizza they have as an option including giardiniera peppers, shrimp, roast beef, broccoli, eggplant, zucchini, and much more.  It's by no means the cheapest pie around, but you'll be happy you paid the extra buck or two once you sink your teeth into the first bite.

Dear Pat's,  you are my favorite pizza delivery restaurant in the city.  Your thin crust pizza is the best.  I order from you at least once a month, if not more, and you will always be on the top of my list.  Keep up the good work, and thanks for the awesome tasting pizza!
Extraordinary pizza. Sauce is a semi sweets but absolutely perfect. Simple cheese is the way to go but personal preference is sausage and gardinara. Weekly devotee.

i've been ordering pat's pizza ever since i moved TO Printer's Row and am still ordering it ever since i've moved FROM Printer's Row. the taste is spot on as is their delivery service. perfectly greasy? duh. expensive? i guess. but the price doesn't deter me, the pizza is THAT good. this will always be my go-to pizza joint. always.

Go thin! Go thin crust! Go thin crust pizza!!   In Chicago, this is the best place I've found for thin crust pizza.  I love it.   So, if I love it that much, why only 4 stars?  Price... For delivery, $30 for a medium pizza is definitely not cheap.   Price may be a bit much, but I do appreciate their personal pizzas which are around $9 with a drink. Shoot, I appreciate their pizza; period.  Because of that, the price takes a back seat while I'm in front munching down all of that yumminess!

The pizza was just ok. I'd heard great things from friends, so we ordered a large veggie pizza one Friday night. At nearly $30 after delivery charge, we finished feeling a bit let down. Would rather it have been DiGorgnio rather than this delivery.

This is more of a review for their customer service. We ordered a pizza a few weeks back and the wrong pizza was delivered.  We called back and were offered a credit, which we thought was fine as we like the pizza. However, we tried to use that credit tonight and were told they could not find it and would not honor the credit. I have the manager's name and date of the order, but still nothing. There are many good places in Chicago for pizza and so we will not be going back to Pat's.  Really? Lose a customer over a credit  you offered - not good customer service!

They have redeemed themselves.  If I could, I would give this a zero. Pizza ordered at 10:40, told less than 45 minutes. Called, 11:54 am, told Pizza on it's way. 12:15 pm, called, told oven broke, Pizza on it's way. 12:25pm Pizza arrives. The thing that really chaps my hide???? This business didn't even bother to call to let us know there were issues. Solution: Never order from here again.

OK - this is five stars for CARRY OUT, which is all you can do at Pat's.  Also know, this is NOT your stereotypical Chicagoland pizza, no deep dish,. This pizza is not greasy at all.  It is delightful and about as healthy as pizza can be! We had the Pat's special but substituted salami for the sausage...you know, being healthy and all that!

This place was extremely hyped up to me by a few coworkers, which I always consider a bad sign. Because hype is usually just that...hype.  When heard everyone clamoring that The Dark Knight was the GREATEST MOVIE EVER and that Heath Ledger was so great in it, I did not go see it in the theater.  No no no.  I passed because I didn't like the hype.  Fast forward 1.5 years and I get it on DVD, and well, dammit, it was a fantastic movie. Damn that Heath Ledger proving my Hype Hypothesis incorrect. But then Pat's renewed my belief in my hypothesis.  Don't get me wrong, it was good pizza.  It was not bad pizza by any means.  But it was not a life altering pizza experience.  I would consider myself quite the pizza connoisseur, so my viewpoint is valid.   I guess the one thing that stands out about Pat's which is a very redeeming quality, is that the crust is thinner than anything I've had in chicago.  When it comes to thin crust, my thoughts turn to Gigio's or Pete's (I live way north, sue me).  But Pat's is just a step thinner.  But again, this is not a bad thing, the pizza was still good.  But just because it's super thin does not mean it's the greatest thing ever. I would eat it again though for sure.  It's A-OK.
Expensive as fuck!!!!!! I hate this place rip off rip off.  These guys deliver a pie with no quality whatsoever!   Wow, Yelp, what is your deal with this place?

I recently had the occasion to throw a party on my rooftop deck downtown and with a busy day became desperate to find food for the party. So I decided to call Pat's Pizzeria, because  had heard it was wonderful. I ordered 5 orders of their unbelievable fabulous fried ravioli with sauce and then a large pizza. They delivered at the exact time I asked them to, and then I put the pizza down, and turned around to get a piece about 3 minutes later and only one piece remained. I grabbed it! How wonderful!! Finally a great thin crust pizza!! Yes! Finally! I was so sick of doughy thick awful pizzas in Chicago, but now I had found my favorite!!  Thank you Pat! Whoever you are. I love your Pizza! It is the best! And so was the ravioli!

Been here three times now in two weeks.  Best thin crust pizza joint in the City.  Its like cracker thin, MMMM!  I've been told the Sasuage isn't the best so maybe stear clear of that.  A Pep pizza is to die for here though!
best thin crust in city.  i keep giving other spots a try and always regret not ordering from here.

Pizza is good. But was verbally assaulted by a delivery  driver outside of the restaurant for waiting for someone to move out of their parking spot. Will never order from there again. Be careful if you head down for pick up.
Sauce is sweet!!! Enough taste where you don't have to ask for anything extra!!! They aren't lying about delivery very FAST!!!!
Thought their thin crust was awesome!  Probably one of the better pizzas I've eaten in the area.  Will be back.

I had Pat's so long ago and remembered how tasty it was so we decided to give them a try again!!! I was not disappointed it was so good!!! The crust was delish! The pizza came in less time than they said and it was fresh! I also ordered fries which were still hot and good! I cant wait to order Pizza again!!!!!

People keep raving about the crust (sure, it was good and all, but can't we agree that it is missing a tiny bit of body in its deliciously thin, crispy form?) but I would rather focus on the other shining aspects of Pats - the sauce, the meatballs, the speedy delivery.  The sauce is what everyone should look for on a pizza. Slight hints of tomato, sweetness, tang, and spices, depending on which bite you take. My only complaint is there wasn't enough sauce, but i would probably swim in a pool made from a pizza crust wall filled in with sauce, so I may not be the best judge here. Meatballs taste like great balls of italian spiced meat. Enough said. The delivery, as mentioned in other reviews, was fast (thirty minutes) and produced hot pizza. Came right when described by the guy on the phone. Can't ask for anything more than that. In essence: try it for the crust, but really savor the sauce.
This is my absolute favorite pizza in the city.  Try fresh tomato, garlic, and roasted red pepper combination!
Favorite thin crust pizza in the South Loop.   The pizza is consistent every time order and ready in 15 minutes!

Seriously people? This thin crust pizza wouldn't stand a chance in New York.  Ok so yes I'm from the best pizza making location this side of Rome, but that's besides the point. I am not a deep dish girl so decided since this had so many good reviews I decided to try it out. Shame on you yelpers..  I did eat it though. I was starving, but it was still a letdown.

I used to live really close to Pat's, and during the winter, my husband and I would get pizza from here about 3 times a week. They make some great thin crust pizza! We would usually get sausage and pepperoni, or if we were feeling like being healthy, we would get a pizza and have all kinds of veggies put on it. Yum! Go and try it!

Not sure if this happens to any other native Chicagoans but I finally got sick of deep dish pizza. Ordered Pat's delivery and was surprised at the quality of the pizza. Will be getting my thin crust from here again.

Quite possibly my favorite pizza. This stuff is also good cold. I hardly eat pizza cold but I will eat Pat's. These guys are more than accommodating and fill huge orders like it's no problem. They are still my go to.

I've turned around my review of Pat's pizza based on one pizza. If you order from Pat's you must try the Quattro Formaggio (Four Cheese). Still not the best in the city, but definitely one of the better South Loop pizza locations.

It's was a toss up between Pat's and Phil's (on 35th Street). But my thing is that I only want to give out one 5-star rating when they're the best in their class. The only reason why Phil's got the 5-star award from me is because they are more generous with their toppings. The taste of both pizza places are the same, in my opinion. Also, last time I remember, there are no seating area, so that kinda sucks. But don't you worry, I'll still order from you because I'm not far! =D
fabulous thin crust pizza (esp if you order extra sauce)!!!

Pretty tasty pizza - it completely reminded me of the pizza from my tiny little hometown.  We got a half cheese half pepperoni, plus some cheese bread.  It wasn't like, amazing, but it's bread covered in cheese which is pretty hard to eff up. A couple of complaints - there's no online menu which is pretty annoying.  Or if there is one, I couldn't find it.  Also delivery is a few dollars, which for a pizza place I also find annoying.  I'm probably just cheap.
The best thin crust you can get without driving down to Palermo's of 95th.

Four stars cause I know its not my eyes playing tricks on me, the pizza is getting smaller! amazing pizza, delicious and really yummy. I highly recommend their house special. Also just mention you have the coupon for 2$ off large pizza over the phone, and they'll give you discount. But seriously, their large pizza used to be bigger, and their size has shrunk. and for that size, I think it's a lil pricey :( also, the pizza is different from their other location, this one is better; I ordered from both and they were two different pizza! all in all, its a good pizza, but the price makes sure I only get it once a month .. which is good for me, given my current physical status!

This review is for Pats thin crust pizza only... I love Pats thin crust pizza, it's actually my favorite thin crust pizza in the city and it happens to be in walking distance from my home :)  It's perfectly super super thin, a good amount of cheese and toppings (although we usually get extra sauce) and amazing flavor.   My dad came over one time and we ordered Pats, I swear he could have finished a large pizza just by himself he loved it so much.   I really only stick with the thin crust pizza at Pats, so I can't comment on or rate the other items (salads, apps) except for noticing that they're pricey for what they are.
I understand this Pat's is family with the PAT's Pizzeria on Lincoln.  However, somewhere along the line they got the recipe for the thin crust pizza messed up.  Reason for my poor rating.

Consistently good thin-crust pizza. Always the right balance of tomato sauce and toppings, just the tiniest bit greasy to make it all the more fun, and decent prices to boot, make Pat's a bit of a gem in a city which sometimes values crazy, dense slabs of pie over more subtle Italian-style authenticity... Not that there's anything wrong with that, it just makes for a refreshing change sometimes.

Consistently tasty pizza.  I love the thin crust pizza and fresh salads.  I would suggest avoiding the chicken wings...just not crispy BUT the sauce is good.  I'm a bit of a friend chicken wing snob, so you might enjoy it .  Calamari is yummy too. You will be pleasantly surprised by the food and quick delivery serivce.   Great delivery service for downtown offices.  I've called ahead of time to schedule a pizza party for staff and it came exactly at the time I requested...AND IT WAS HOT.

So I am so picky with pizza and especially when it comes to thin crust....but pat's pizza is AMAZING!!! I grew up eating thin crust (St. Louis) style and I can never find a thin crust in Chicago that tastes good but this was seriously so good. My husband even thinks it's better then Lou's thin crust and that's impressive! The crust itself is paper thin and not that crunchy dough they use on other thin crust pizzas. The toasted ravioli was fantastic (super big pieces) and the garlic cheese bread was awesome. So overall, this is my #1 pizza spot in Chicago now!  They are super fast at delivery and they take your order quickly...they really have it down and I was impressed.  5 STARS!! The BEST thin crust pizza in Chicago!

The first pizza we ordered was burned. I called to report it and they were awesome about it and offered to re-make, re-deliver and add a 6 pack of soda. Sweet!  An hour later I had to re-call to find out where the pizza was. It was bordering on 2 hours from our initial  call and we were now starving. The replacement came and it was pretty good but I think that with this being Chicago a burned pizza should NEVER leave the kitchen and a replacement pizza should be practically helicoptered to my door. Is it just me?

The owner is an incredibly friendly chap.  I enjoyed making his acquaintance. The pie is good, but not great.  The cheese could do with being a bit more browned on top and the sauce needs a lot of work.  Using a homemade sauce would be preferable and if the sauce is homemade and I failed to pick up on it, then it needs to be revisited.

It is a pain in the pita to get pizza for co-workers that have as many opinions as mine do: there's too much sauce, the crust isn't thin, blah blah blah...  Anyway, I remember eating Pat's in the past and I figured we could try it again.  Lo and behold, 24 of 29 employees agree that they like this pizza!  (Of course there would be a few dissenters.) The crust is cracker thin, there is a good amount of ingredients, the sauce is pretty good (although a tad bit too sweet for me).  And the best part is that they were delivered hot and on time.  I will definitely be ordering from here again.

To begin with I rarely discriminate with Pizza. All pizza is good on some level. However as a south looper for the last decade I thing that Pat's is the best! We even did a "Pizza off" vs another local delivery and Pat's came out on top. This is Chicago and to be competitive you have to be something a lot of things right. Give them a good college try and you will see.

I love Pat's signature thin crust pizza! It has the perfect ratio of cheese, sauce, bread, and toppings. The workers are very friendly and the price is great. I just wish they would deliver to my neighborhood!
Honestly Pat's is the best THIN crust pizza in the city. I try not to eat it that often because Ill eat the whole thing. Don't confuse it with the one in Lincoln Park...they are not the same owner

A-OK.  the pizza's good, doesnt blow ur pants off or anything....theres nothing to say about the atmosphere cus its more of a take-out/delivery spot.  they do have counter space if u need it tho.  if u want some reliable, good pizza, here's a place for u.

The thin crust pizza is pretty decent for chicago.  It's too cheesy to completely imitate a true New York pizza, but it comes close (if only it is cut in real slices!) Pat's also delivers, and even though they said our large pizza would take 45 minutes, it came in less than 20, so a plus there. A large vegetarian pizza ended up costing about $31 including delivery & tip, so it was a little pricey for what it was...but truth be told we'll probably be ordering from Pat's again until we find a better thin crust alternative!

Pat's has excellent pizza, friendly staff and super quick delivery (mine came in about 30 minutes!) Watch for coupons in the Money Mailer because it is fairly expensive pizza - $22 for a large one-topping thin crust with coupon and delivery!
Excellent pizza, you won't be disappointed.  Not the cheapest game in town, but very good.  Only complaint is the cost otherwise I would have given them 5 stars
I've gotten Pat's a couple of times for take out, and have always been happy with the service and with the food.  I called on a Thursday night and only had to wait 20 minutes before picking up. mmmm.

When we lived in the Loop, we ordered Pat's quite a bit as the location was close and delivery was always fairly prompt. Truth be told, I rarely, if ever really enjoyed it, however, Amy loves their thin crust with a variety of toppings, so we'd generally order from here about 1/2 the time we got pizza. I always thought it was WAY overpriced for the quality, especially in comparison to other pizza places where the food is much better. Anytime a mediocre medium pizza, salad, delivery, tax = $35, something is wrong.  Anyway, since moving to the West Loop, we've been ordering from other (better) spots , however, Amy had her craving for Pats today and we ordered it. Suffice to say, it took about 80 minutes (20 minutes over the quoted time) to arrive and the pizza and garlic bread were cold. They also managed to send the wrong type of soda. How difficult is it to get a soda correct? I called them up and was put on the phone with Nick (I'm guessing the manager). He was in fact VERY nice and apologetic and although he said they were slammed, didn't try to use that as an excuse for the cold food. His offer was $5 off and a free liter of soda next time we order. IMO, this was a pretty crap offer and food should have either been comped or replaced. I didn't push for replacement since we didn't want to wait another 90 minutes for food, so I agreed - although, it's going to take all of my other favorite places going out of business for me to agree to order from here again. I guess Amy will have to use the credit when she is eating solo!

Solid thin crust pizza for delivery in the S Loop and Near West Side.  It is our go-to for pizza.  We always ask for it well done as otherwise the cheese is sometimes missing that little bit of brown on top that makes it especially gooey. The fried raviolis are excellent as well. We live on the other side of UIC, and delivery is always fast & hot.

I used to order Pat's frequently, but I went on hiatus several years ago because my live-in beloved prefers another spot for his pizza. On a night when he was out, I found myself craving Pat's fantastically crispy cracker-thin crust, so I ordered from my old neighborhood favorite. The pizza came quickly and it was wonderfully hot, but boy, was I disappointed when I took my first bite! This was not the pizza of yesteryear.
