The crust was dense, floury and tasteless without a hint of crunch. I swear they just recycled a crust from a stale Tombstone pizza. The taste of the sauce was fine, the cheese was generously applied, the pepperoni evenly and appropriately placed...but where were my artichoke hearts? Pat's considers artichoke hearts a premium topping and therefore charges double the price of a regular topping to add them. Sadly all I got were a few artichoke LEAVES on my heartless pizza. I would have been better off buying a jar across the street and adding them myself. I felt ripped off and unsatisfied. I was so disappointed, sigh. Should have ordered Thai.
Pat's I love you. You have the best thin crust pizza...and you deliver right to my door. We have never had a bad experience - afternoon, evening, late night - I love love love you.

I order pizza from here almost every time I order pizza...when I order from someplace else, just for a change of pace...I often think, "This is good, and no regrets...but I kinda miss Pat's..."  They must put something in the sauce.... I've always gotten quick delivery, courteous order takers/drivers, and tasty pizza....the triple crown! Love me some Pat's.

If you're looking for a tasty, hot, ooey gooey cheesy pizza....you've found your place! Generous with toppings, and did I mention CHEESY?! They do not skimp on the cheese. The crust is thin, but perfect! I have found heaven!

In Chicago, we're all about that Deep Dish pizza... but when you go thin crust, you go Pats. It is probably one of my favorite thin crusts in the world.  {I should note that I have only done delivery} It's thin, but doesn't get too crispy.  It also has the perfect balance between sauce and cheese - neither overpowers the other.  Also, their delivery is impressive. It's usually quick and is it hot.   While some places aren't as friendly with takeout orders, that is not the case here.

Pat's is really very good pizza.  I must admit I'm getting a bit tired of it though because we order it a lot (my dad is gay for Pat's pizza and insists we order it every time he visits, which is a lot).  I live in Lakeshore East and for fast delivery pizza it is either Pat's or Scarpino's- totally different experiences so depends on what you're in the mood for.  Pat's I go to when I want fast, plain (or one topping) thin crust pizza.    Everyone is right- it is FAST delivery.  A bit on the pricey side for sure but I don't mind paying a few bucks more when it's fast and hot, and honestly really good.  In my opinion, there is one thin crust pizza in the city that beats Pats and that is Calo's in Andersonville.  Otherwise, Pat's all the way.

I am so confused by the reviews unless I just got them on a bad night. The crust tastes like paper, the sauce decent and the cheese sub par. Someone referred to this as NY style pizza, absolutely not. I must say I have lost a bit of faith in the integrity of yelp reviews as I really dont understand how this could be a 4 star pizza.

Its hard to screw up pizza... Not the best nor the worst I've ever had.  The sweet sauce was sweet indeed. Felt it should have been a few bucks cheaper... People were in love so I decided to try it. I wasn't in love with it. Perhaps too high of expectations.

After reading many mixed reviews about Pat's Pizza I decided to take a chance and order take out. The pizza was ready very quickly, which is a huge deal breaker for me; when I'm hungry, I'm hungry!  I usually enjoy deep dish or pan, but I think Pat's has turned me into a thin crust girl. The ingredients were fresh, there was a good ratio of  cheese to toppings. I'll definitely order out from Pat's again.
BEST THIN CRUST IN THE CITY! I don't eat pizza anywhere else now that I've found Pat's Pizza. Their delivery people have always been on time too.

I've had Pat's pizza twice as far as pizza goes I have no complaints. The crust is really thin, but I like it that way the toppings seem to be plentiful, delivery was also pretty quick. Besides their pizza they have a whole menu full of everything from rib dinners to sandwiches haven't sampled anything else yet, so I'll keep you post it

First off, let me just say that I am in favor of public crucifixion if it's done tastefully. But having said that, let me tell you about Pat's Pizzeria. My coworkers and I go there all the time. When we have guests at the office, we order Pat's. The pizza? Not the greatest, by far. Cracker-thin crust that gets hard too quickly, all the cheese comes off, but it's good enough in a pinch. The other stuff, though, really nice. You'll get probably the best burger anywhere near Printers Row, and the prices are cheap. (I don't understand the "$$"  in the description -- for six bucks you can get a really good cheeseburger and fries!) Sandwiches are very enjoyable, mozzarella sticks are excellent (which is very important to me!). I haven't really dealt with many of the staff -- about 75% of the time I deal with the son of the owner, and he's a really friendly guy. There's a woman there from time  to time, darned if I can remember her name, but she's also quite friendly. The only real complaint I have about this place is that the fries leave much to be desired -- but a little bit of salt is a big help. Well, that, and the drink selection is odd -- either a can, a one-liter bottle, or a two-liter bottle -- I prefer the 20-ounce bottle, myself...but that's just one guy's opinion. My recommendation: call in your order in advance; everything's made to order, so it could take about ten minutes, and it's not a sit-down place.

I just came from a St Pat's day party and we decided to order pizzas from Pat's Pizza (how fitting).  We ordered 5 pizzas: one large spinach, mushroom and olive, two large pepperoni's, one large mushroom and an additional medium cheese pizza.  All of them turned out well and for thin crust pizza, as in thin as a cracker, they were all very pleasing to my taste buds.  I will reiterate though, stay away from ordering anything too exotic here (i.e. BBQ Pizza). I suspect the staff of "non-hablantes"  don't understand this concept.
I love this thin crust pizza.  They are usually really, REALLY fast with delivery too.  Damn good pizza.

This is the best thin crust pizza in the South Loop... perhaps in Chicago.  Lou Malnatti's has them beat if someone is looking for Deep Dish pizza... but for thin crust, WOW! .. just had a large thin crust delivered... it came sooner than promised, piping hot and CRISP!!  I give Pat's Pizza FIVE stars for thin crust pizza.

Ok it is not the best pizza in the world I will admit. But when there are like 2 choices for Pizza in the South Loop area and you don't like Chicago style pizza...this is an excellent option. I am a vegetarian and it was pretty tasty but yes I think we have all had better and pizza seems to be a pretty personal choice.  Grab a pizza loving friend and take the doggies get some pizza and eat it out on the sidewalk and share in a slice of Pat's.

Great thin crust pizza! I come here for lunch sometimes and you can order a personal pizza (all personals are thin crust) for about $6. Four ingredients are included in the veggie personal pizza. My favs are egg plant, garlic, spinich and tomatoes. Delicious!!! I recommend calling ahead of time if you are going to order for lunch otherwise you will be sitting there waiting for your food! (thats what happened to me) They also serve pastas and italian entrees. They deliver as North as North Avenue, west as Western Avenue, East as Lake Shore Drive, and South as 31st street ($2.75 delivery charge). I love Pat's!
Best thin crust in the South Loop. Great salads. The delivery guys wil get it done for you. Get extra cheese, tomato, spinach, sausage. Just plain cheese rivals D'Agostino's.

Bad on many fronts. Starving, we place a massive order. Two pasta dishes with two salads and garlic bread.  Three desserts. The two pasta dishes were ok at best.  For $15 a piece, definitely not worth it.  I could make better with some $0.99 spagetti from costco. The salads were old and many of the leaves were browning.  NEITHER CAME WITH DRESSING!!!!  Are you kidding me!??!  No salad dressing for your salads!!!  Yeah, yeah, you probably thought we love brown lettuce.  Grrrrr. Now, the capper.  They called after we placed the order and told us they didn't have 2 out of the 3 desserts we ordered. Whaaaaaaaat?!!?!  In replacement they gave us a pint of spomoni and a little stale chocolate bundt cake. The garlic bread barely tasted like garlic bread and was literally, I'm not kidding you, A SUB ROLL! The best part of the meal were the Diet Pepsis.

Few things make a single gal happier than a pizza date.  Unless this is the pizza.  Saying this even though I did not pay for sa(i)d pizza. Which should put this review into perspective.  Realizing this is about to turn into a cage-fight, let me tell you this is my OPINION and in my opinion, it was comparable to Tombstone, in the freezer of any local grocery or corner store- yes- I said it- the crust alternated between sodden mass and crunchy crusty as a cracker. Blech. No, no, no... No second date.  He can blame the pizza.

Not a fan..However, I did manage to eat half of a 16 " thin crust pizza. Pat's pizza claims to have the best thin crust in the world, so I tried it out---in my opinion, not so much the best crust.  It's the super thin cracker crust that gets flimsy after a few minutes and the flavor doesn't do anything for me.  On the other hand, this kind of crust is good for those who are watching their carb intake. As the pizza got colder, the cheese's  true personality came out.  Cheap and fake.  I started peeling the cheese off it was so bad (so I guess that doesn't count as an entire half of 16") I was with a guy friend and he was just happy to have Pepperoni and lots of extra toppings from me picking everything off.  So I'm guessing he would give Pat's 4 or 5 stars. I will not be ordering Pat's again, but glad I tried it.

Ok, we ordered the thin crust for an office party and everyone was satisfied. I ordered the Chicken Vesuvio and it was an entire tasteless, tough, chicken with a few potatoes and a handful of peas.  Bleh! Then I ordered another thin crust. Good. Then I tried the lasagna. There was one layer and then two thick pieces of lasagna stuck together at the bottom surrounded by a sea of greasy sauce. It tasted awful and with the lasagna stuck together it was undercooked and tough. If you aren't going for the pizza...don't go.
My go-to for thin crust pizza!  My favorite is a thin crust (various toppings) -well done with extra sauce....  The crust is nice and cracker-y and the sauce is tangy and full of goodness.

Ah, the beauty of Yelp! Love and hate. Malice and infatuation. Well, if there is one truth we all share, pizza is the perfect food, and contrary to all the five stars (five, really?) on there, it ain't all that. Now then, I have never turned away a pizza. Ever. It's sacrilegious. But damned if I don't try every other pizza place in the Printer's Row, South Loop area before we go back. We ordered a 16" sausage and onion. We ate it all. We were hungry, but the dough was floury and doughy. . . almost undercooked. And the cheese wasn't well done enough for my liking.  We will go back, but like I said. . . there are more pies in the sea.

worst pizza i've ever had. I've tried it three times to be completely sure, and yes: I'm sure. Only go to pat's if you're really desperate and Edwardo's is closed. . . . you can walk a block away to Edwardo's, trust me it's worth the extra few yards.

I LOVE YOU, P!!! Was having an election night party, and this P does NOT cook, so I really needed some pizza and wings to satiate the crew. I called in at 4:10 pm and requested a 5 pm deliver time. Pat promised he would do the best he could, even though some of the roads were being shut down around the south loop to prepare for Obama's rally, and sure enough, he did it! YES HE CAN! It was freakin' delicious (try the veggie and the hawaiian thin crust), and my stress levels went from 10 to 0 immediately - I got pizza, wings, beer, and a President Obama - what more do you want?!?!

Love this pizza! Best thin crust around! I always order waaay too much because I just get soo excited thinking about it. Delivery time is usually at least a good 45 mins, but it always shows up quicker then they say.  All thin crust lovers out there will DIE for this pizza!!

This is by far the best thin crust pizza in the city that I have tried.  I come from the burbs, so Jake's Pizza was always my "go to."  But, this pizza comes in a close second.  Best option for thin crust pizza! (We ordered delivery--decent delivery time)

The bread crust was great.  Perfect crisp with a slightly chewy top.  We got a sausage and tomato pizza and it was top notch. The best thing was the speedy delivery.  He promised 45 minutes to an hour and it came in 20 minutes. I just wish it was cheaper so I could fatten up on this.

Since moving to the South Loop, this has quickly become my de facto pizza place.  Its not the best thin crust in the city, but it is the best in the neighborhood.  The sauce has a great balance of tomato and sweet flavor.
Not for me....I don't know what they hype is here....The WestEnd has better thin crust than this.  No....really.....they do!

I ordered from this place over the weekend fully expecting to be disappointed after looking at all the stellar reviews. But this place lives up to the hype! Truly the best this crust pizza I've had in a VERY long time. Outstanding pizza, good delivery time, reasonable prices...for thin crust, I definitely have a new favorite pizza joint.

I used to order from Pat's for my company's weekly luncheons. We either did a variety of pizza's (thin crust of course) or the full order pans of baked mostaccioli, fettuchinne alfredo with chicken and house salad. It was always a hit, week after week! This place is delicious and always on time for delivering catered events.

If you like really thin crust pizza with a light crisp crust Pat's is great. Their delivery guys are great - always quick and polite. I love Pat's! Yum! (PS I don't know about other locations- only this one)

They serve up some great Chicago thin crust here for a decent enough price.  A+ for the service; everyone I've met who works there has had a great attitude, especially Nick, grandson of Pat.  He let us know to keep an eye out for coupons, then hooked us up with a liter of pop anyway.  I especially dig the location; the South Loop suffers from having all the close restaurants only open for lunch rush.  Pat's is always there for us...well, unless you're looking for some later-night eats (if anyone knows a good place for that around here, please let me know!)

we order from these guys like clockwork almost every sunday. hands down the BEST thin crust pizza i have ever had. i suggest the bar-b-que chicken pizza. its pretty awesome. order from pats. they rule.

There are plenty of great pizza places in Chicago.  Yet I end up ordering Pat's Pizza almost once every week.  This place is by far my favorite thin-crust pizza. It's gotta be the sauce, right?  Is it the crust?  They are both SO good.  My personal combo is sausage, spinach, and broccoli, but I usually order half with just pepperoni for my friend that orders with me.  She hates spinach... which is cool because whenever there's any spinach on her side, she gives me those pieces too.  (So yes - I'm a pig when it comes to Pat's.) If you still have room, the cheesecake is great too.  But don't trust my review of the cheesecake.  I've never met a cheesecake I didn't like.

I don't know if it's a life-changing experience like some other reviews, but it's very good Italian take-out / delivery with above-average pizza.  The style for the thin crust is sort of hearty--they definitely don't stint on the toppings!

Sooo0o good.  Pat's is literally a hidden hole in the wall on Clark St.... not exactly somewhere you'd want to dine or take a date, but don't be detoured.  Order delivery or carry out -- you won't regret it.  The thin crust pizza is absolute perfection!!

This is the best thin crust pizza I have ever had.  The typical topping combination that I order is tomato, spinach, and sausage.  The tomatoes are nice and juicy, the spinach is not too over-cooked, and there is just the right amount of sausage.  I have also tried artichoke, tomato, and spinach, which is also very tasty.  Another combination that I have done is salami, tomato, and spinach.  I was not as impressed with this because the salami was in large thick slices and was difficult to bite.  Once I have branched out from the thin crust pizza and ordered the creamy pesto tortellini.  It was very saucy, creamy, and tasty. Downfall: Delivery can take 45-60 minutes.

Audrey and I were watching John C's twin baby girls on Saturday night in the South Loop and were looking to order in.  We thumbed through the Chung's take out menus and it was between Yang and Pat's Pizzeria. John shouted "Get the cheesy garlic bread!" Pat's Pizzeria (Not to be confused with Pat's Pizza on Lincoln) it was. We ordered a 14 Inch Thin Crust Half Pepperoni and half Canadian Bacon & Pineapple Pizza. And of course we ordered some of this Cheesy Garlic bread John was raving about.  As promised, the pizza arrived 45 minutes after placing the order.  Not as promised, Addison woke up what seemed like 10 times snorting, screaming, and crying.  Luckily Audrey took care of the screaming baby while I housed my fair share of pizza and cheesy garlic bread.  I would have totally held her, but my hands were covered in pepperoni grease.  The sauce, cheese, the crust, and toppings were all spot on.  It reminded me a little of Falco's or Just A Pizza Plus from my old neighborhood.  This was definitely one of the better pizza's I have had in quite some time.  The Cheesy Garlic Bread was just straight up delicious!  Pat's is an old school pizza joint and that's exactly what I was hoping for on Saturday night.  The next time I order I plan on putting Pat's to the true test by ordering a sausage, mushroom, onion, and green pepper pie.  Yummmm. I believe that Pat's is take out only so the ambiance and dcor really don't matter.  The pizza was delivered within in the window quoted by the gentleman who took my order. So the service was top notch!  I'm stingy when it comes to handing out 4 or 5 star rating's, but I loved the pizza and couldn't find anything wrong with the experience.  Good on you Pat's Pizzeria! 1 14 Inch Pizza w/ 3 Toppings 1 Cheesy Garlic Bread 1 Free Liter of Dr. Pepper (w/ coupon) -------------------------------------------------------- $25.00

Four stars for great thin crust pizza.  They have decent shrimp, calamari, and steak sandwiches.  But it's the pizza I'll come back for. I'd give them five stars except I ordered the slab of ribs last night.  The sauce was good, but the ribs were underdone.  Chewy and stringy.  I heated the leftovers today at 275 degrees for two hours, and they came out tender and falling off the bone like they SHOULD have right from the restaurant.

Nobody does thin crust better in the city. Light on the sauce, with just enough sweetness. Slightly burnt edges but unscathed underneath. And one delivery guy who wears a suit WITH tie to deliver. Now that is taking pies seriously. Everybody has their pizza opinion, but for my money Pat's cannot be beat. And do NOT confuse this place with the one on Lincoln, you'll make an angel lose his wings.

My office orders Pat's for lunch all the time - and as far as thin crust pizza is concerned, this place does not disappoint! It's almost a cracker-crust, to give you an idea of the thickness. The house salad is very tasty too, always fresh and a nice contrast to the greasy goodness of the pizza :) Though I don't dream about Pat's like some other pizza places in the city (I'm thinking of you, Pequod's!) it's a great place to try if you're in the area.

I guess I went to Pat's on a bad night because my pizza was cold, bland and stuck to the cardboard. Everything else was actually pretty good except I don't know if the people who actually own Pat's are Italian but who the hell makes an open face Eggplant Parm sandwich???? I feel very bad that I cheated on my man at PIzzeria Millan.  It's just.. I mean.. Pat's put a flyer on my door handle and the menu was full of so many things that seemed so yummy... I'm sorry Pizzeria Millan, I'll never stray again.

When you are hungry for pizza, Pat's is the only choice.  We always order a thin crust spinich, sliced tomatoes, and sausage.  Although delivery can be slow and it is a little pricey, it is well worth it.  I am surprised by Matthew's comments because Pat's is a great place for quality pizza.

Only thing good about Pat's Pizza is that they delivered when they promised. Otherwise, skip this for ANY of the other options located nearby. The pizza had zero taste, no spices, sauce sucked and didn't go even close to the edge of the crust. The crust itself was nothing special, and the toppings were a bit sparse. Aurelio's is better than this and is just as close for delivery.

Finally I ordered the thin crust pizza and it was really good. The taste reminds me of Casola's in Miami (see my review of Casola's) but the crust is just a bit too thin. It needs to be just a tad bit thicker so that it has a bit of a crunch to it. For example, when I reheated it in my toaster oven, the crust was melting with the cheese. It should be crunchy again.  Regardless, so far I am happy with Pat's and Pizano's (you have to be in the mood for the Pizano's crust though).  Oh, and it turns out that on delivery you need to pay cash? Whatever, they worked it out and that was nice.

I really love Pat's pizza!!!  I'm so sorry that many people can't enjoy it more since they are out of the delivery area or are just set in their pizza ways.  : )   The thin crust pizza is DELICIOUS.  I would recommend this to anyone who enjoys thin crust.  I have also had breaded mushrooms and salad from Pat's.  I have never been disappointed w/ a pizza from Pat's......says a lot coming from a Princess.  ; )

Yessss Pat's is choice pizza. I work not too far from here. Thin crust cheese is good, used to always get it delivered to my guy Al's place in the S Loop...order of calamari as well with extra sauce and extra lemons, it does the job and used to be a standard friday evening predrinkin dinner before we went out on the town. Worth gettin for sure.

OMG!!!  I wish I still lived in the South Loop to experience this fantastic thin crust pizza.  It is awesome.  (And Pat's Lincoln Park DOES NOT COMPARE.) Their other food was never really good.  But who cares because their pizza is awesome!  No idea why it is so good but it is.

Fantastic thin crust pizza.  The crust is exceptionally thin, light, crispy and the toppings are fresh and abundant.  They tend to cut the pizza in strange rectangular shapes, with some very large pieces next to some very small ones (I have no idea why.)  Whenever I'm feeling lazy, hungry and piggish I tend to gorge on Pat's.  Yum.

This is one of my favorite pizza places. I love the thin crust... and there's a lot of sauce, which I love. A lot of other pizzas seem to heavier on the cheese than the sauce (Hello, Lou Malnati's!). So good.

Even though it says on their menu "Not affiliated w/Pat's on N Lincoln Ave"the pizza is the same.  I will say the chicken wing were pretty bad.  I asked the guy on the phone for buffalo wings.  They sent bbq wings.  I looked at the menu, and I guess thats the only kind of wings they have.  Yuck.  Pizza was fine though.
